sn2.27:1.1: Standing to one side, the young deva Nanda recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn2.27:2.1: “Time flies by, the nights swiftly pass;
sn2.27:2.2: The stages of life successively desert us.
sn2.27:2.3: Seeing clearly this danger in death,
sn2.27:2.4: One should do deeds of merit that bring happiness. ”
sn2.27:3.1: “Time flies by, the nights swiftly pass;
sn2.27:3.2: The stages of life successively desert us.
sn2.27:3.3: Seeing clearly this danger in death,
sn2.27:3.4: A seeker of peace should drop the world’s bait. ”
